task.name: ZeroLegacyProvisioning
task.description: An Provisioning Task Job instance reads the entries from an LDAP Legacy source and send the provisionning request for OIM.

string-param.helpText: The IT Resource used to establish the connection to the LDAP Source System.
The technical application name in OIM
The DN entry where begin account and access descriptions.
The Organisation Name where the scheduled task will operate on.
The RDN entry where application accesses are stored.
The object class of the entry that represents accesses to the application.
The attribute name of the entry that holds members to the application.
User login for which the report will be send.
The notification template used for sending the report.

task.name: ZeroAccountProvisioning
task.description: An Provisionning Task Job instance reads the entries from an LDAP source and send the provisioning task to OIM.

string-param.helpText: The IT Resource used to establish the connection to the LDAP Source System.
The DN entry where begin account and access descriptions.
The Organisation Name where the scheduled task will operate on.
The RDN entry where application accesses are stored.
The object class of the entry that represents accesses to the application.
The attribute name of the entry that holds members to the application.
The root RDN entry where entitlements of the application are stored.
The object class of the entry that represents an entitlement in LDAP.
The attribute name of the entry that holds the name of the entitlement (Default value: cn).
The attribute name of the entry that holds entitlement members.
The name of the namespace where the entitlement belong to.
The attribute name of the Child Form that holds entitlement value.
User login for which the report will be send.
The notification template used for sending the report.

task.name: ZeroAccountRevoke
task.description: A Revoking Task Job instance checks LDAP entries no longer available and send the revoke task to OIM.

string-param.helpText: The IT Resource used to establish the connection to the LDAP Source System.
The DN entry where begin account and access descriptions.
The Organisation Name where the scheduled task will operate on.
The RDN entry where application accesses are stored.
The object class of the entry that represents accesses to the application.
The attribute name of the entry that holds members to the application.
User login for which the report will be send.
The notification template used for sending the report.
